intro: Thladiantha ziroensis, commonly known as the Ziro nightshade, is a flowering plant native to the Eastern Himalayas. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes tomatoes, potatoes, and peppers. The plant is characterized by its woody stems, opposite leaves, and showy, star-shaped flowers that range in color from white to purple. It produces small, berry-like fruits that are typically yellow or orange when mature. The species is often found in moist, shaded habitats at high elevations.
